newsitem.title: USA: Cluster Technology says it gets FDA ok.
newsitem.headline: Cluster Technology says it gets FDA ok.

text.p: Cluster Technology Corp said Friday it has received FDA approval for a proprietary medical device approved to treat chronic intractable pain and post traumatic acute pain.

Cluster said the device is non-drug, non-invasive treatment that has been clinically proven to cure approximately 80 percent of migraine and headache patients over a three-week treatment course, as well as other specific pain.
This technology belongs to Cluster Technology Corp. under its agreement with Dr. Shealy.

Cluster's wholly owned subsidiary, Professional Distribution Systems, Inc. will manufacture the product in America. The first products will be ready to sell in September of this year and will be marketed domestically and internationally.
